series.name: India and Bangladesh in Sri Lanka T20I Tri-Series, 2018
series.short_name: IND and BAN in SL T20I Tri-Series

comm_lines.comm: Good day for the tri-series then. Showstoppers India get off the mark, having now beaten Bangladesh in six out of the six Twenty20 Internationals they have come up against. Sri Lanka and Bangladesh lock horns on Saturday at the Premadasa, so expect people to outnumber sundries on the day at least. We'll be back for that. Until next time, this is Pratyush Sinha bidding goodbye alongside Akshay Maanay, K Nagaraju, Raju Peethala and Nikhil Jadhav. Have a great week ahead. It's three days to Monday.. ta-ta!
Moments you may or may not have missed from the second T20I of the Nidahas Trophy, between India and Bangladesh from the R. Premadasa Stadium, Shirshendu Roy captures it all in his snapshots

Rohit - captain, India: "I think it was a great performance, something that was expected from us. Right from the start to the end, it was clinical and a complete team effort. We looked into what went wrong in the game against Sri Lanka and we thought hitting the length was the option for us. We wanted their batsmen to take on the longer boundaries. Bowlers executed plans very well. We kept it simple and got the basics right, which was missing in the first game. Catching is something where there's always room for improvement. We want to get better as a fielding side. We are much better than that."

Mahmudullah - captain, Bangladesh: "We didn't bat well. We should have scored 30 more runs. We need to find out how to get runs on these kind of wickets. Think the bowlers did a pretty good job. We need to rotate the strike more often. Dot balls create pressure on batsmen. Need to find gaps and get boundaries in the middle overs. One win will boost us and will reflect in our game. Hopefully we'll get it."

Vijay Shankar - Player of the Match: "Been looking forward to this. Have been working hard, so very happy. Bowling has given me something extra in my game. We got wickets today, which helped us restrict them. A lot of people (inspired me). Being with this team is a dream for every cricketer. Everyone in the dressing room is very supportive."
harinath says: Then, when will DK get his chance, after his retirement?
Hang on for the presentations.. (6 guests, three cardboard cheques and Roshan Abeysinghe await us)

10:32pm local: A dumpster fire is more alive than this match ever was. The fact that Bangladesh couldn't lay into a second-string Indian side that was conceding extras and dropping catches -- as many as four -- is harrowing. And then to see young batsmen and Rohit Sharma fail in a chase sustained solely by the genius of Shikhar Dhawan must hurt, especially the new-age Bangladesh. India sailed through on yet another fifty by their left-handed opener, who's left his limitations behind in the yellow pages. What will this team do without him?

Rubel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, diving half-stop at point by Mehidy but that won't matter much. Manish Pandey has thrown his hands at the width and gotten his side over the line. India win by 6 wickets
Rupesh says: Two things I will never be able to understand in cricket, 1st D/L Method, 2nd left arm bowler not bowling to left handed batsmen.
Rubel to Manish Pandey, no run, doesn't get the timing right. Throws his hands and miscues the drive to cover
Scores level
Rubel to Karthik, 1 run, stays in the crease and slices this ball towards extra cover. Softs the impacts, and hence could buy some time for the single
Ganesh katigar says: Vijay Shankar should have been promoted in place of Karthik!!
Rubel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, cramped for room, Manish Pandey punches this back of a length delivery straight down the ground. 2 needed
Rubel Hossain [3.0-0-21-2] is back into the attack
The last over, hopefully

Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower delivery ticked straight to square leg. And they've charged across for the run. And the throw at the bowler's end wasn't going to scare Manish Pandey one bit. 3 runs needed
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, FOUR, there's width again and there's Manish Pandey at it again. Gets on his toes, reaches out and cuts it uppishly through cover-point
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, no run, back-footed to run this round the corner. Finds the fielder though. Mustafizur tries to cramp Manish Pandey for room this time
I'm just counting down the runs for fun. You know why
Mustafizur to Karthik, 1 run, scythes at the width and thrashes it behind the point fielder. 8 needed

Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, 1 run, stays put and uses his hands to guide the ball behind backward point. He's using the width that Mustafizur's over the wicket angle to the right-hander comes readymade with. 9 needed
Mustafizur to Manish Pandey, FOUR, 119ks cutter going across Manish Pandey who deftly guides it late through third man. Dive in the deep but that's for nothing. 10 needed
Mustafizur Rahman [3.0-0-20-1] is back into the attack
Taskin Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 1 run, manoeuvres this from the crease. Just opens the face of the bat to guide this back of a length delivery past point. Just the 14 needed
Taskin Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, uppishly punched over cover. Gets lucky with a little bit of height else.. Early into the shot
Dinesh Karthik, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, out Caught by Liton Das!! Miscues it to deep mid-wicket. Taskin Ahmed was bowling from round the wicket, Dhawan tries to lay into that with his leg-side loft but gets it a bit straighter than intended. End of another of Dhawan's specials. He's nearly gotten India there.Dhawan c Liton Das b Taskin Ahmed 55(43) [4s-5 6s-2]
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!
Taskin Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 1 run, gets tall with the length and swivel-pulls this short ball one-legged, pirouetting on his left toe
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, 1 run, pushes it on the up to mid-off. Quick single in the face of that wide throw
Taskin Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length outside off, shunted to third man
Taskin Ahmed [2.0-0-22-0] is back into the attack
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, no run, played back to a full ball and squirts it out somehow. Bails out, though. Mushfiq ran back and stylishly deflected the ball onto the stumps
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, 1 run, now a full toss that's punches to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, FOUR, possibly the worst follow-up delivery you can bowl. Beat him with turn last ball and now drops one short. Pulled off the back foot
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, no run, a bit of turn. Manish Pandey's wanting to run a single to third man and nearly edges it to the keeper
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, 1 run, fired flat on middle and leg, stabbed to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Manish Pandey, 1 run, outside off, Manish Pandey pushes a single to long-off
Rubel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, cramped by this back of a length delivery that kicks up extra, but Manish Pandey's nicely ridden it wide of cover. 27 needed off 30
Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, slower length ball on the pads, Dhawan waits and swats it round the corner
Rubel to Dhawan, no run, back of a length 137ks delivery angled across, Dhawan can't get it past the off-side infield
Rubel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, stabbed to cover for a single
Rubel to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, gets off the mark with a jabby ramp over the slipper. Rahman runs across and cuts it off from deep backward point. Looked like a boundary until then
Manish Pandey, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Rubel to Raina, out Caught by Mehidy Hasan!! Once they find you out, they find you out. Short ball gets Raina again. Was caught in an awkward position, trying to play a short ball with a crouch instead of off back foot. Ends up chipping it tamely to the fielder at square leg. Raina c Mehidy Hasan b Rubel 28(27) [4s-1 6s-1]
Rubel to Raina, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!
Rubel Hossain [2.0-0-16-1] is back into the attack

jayaraman says: Hope India get a chance to test Vijay's batting at least in the next t20. He's a better batsman than bowler. Could be a bonus to have him and Pandya in the same team, hopefully in England
Nazmul Islam to Raina, 1 run, this time only as far as mid-on. Use of the feet again. 32 needed
Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, 1 run, comes down the track and stabs it to long-on
Nazmul Islam to Raina, 1 run, pinches a single through covers

Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, byes, 1 run, this skidded on straight after pitching. Dhawan was long way down the track, doesn't get bat to ball, and yeah that's a missed stumping. Keeper makes a meal of it. Didn't read it either. None of them

Nazmul Islam to Dhawan, FOUR, consecutive fifties for Dhawan. Gets there off an absolute filth. Nazmul Islam sees him making room, fired it down leg. Way down leg. And Dhawan just helped it through fine leg
Claps go around as India rack up 100
Prashi Relangi says: Wondering why Mahmudullah is fearing to hand the ball to Nazmul Hasan. Sometimes lefty to lefty might work as well. -- Here he is..
Nazmul Islam to Raina, 1 run, fired on the bast of leg-stump from over the wicket, squirted out to deep square leg.
Nazmul Islam, left-arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Mahmudullah to Dhawan, no run, comes down the track and finds extra cover with his soft-handed punch. He's gotten singles off these tonight -- plenty of them -- but not this time. 41 needed
Mahmudullah to Raina, 1 run, turns it to backward square leg
Mahmudullah to Dhawan, 1 run, got too close to the pitch of the ball there. Used his feet and then had to chip it out towards long-off
siddesh says: Players like Rishabh Pant and Vijay Shankar should be given long run keeping 2019 World Cup in mind
Mahmudullah to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan shows how to deal with lengths like these. Rocks back and mauls the drag-down over deep mid-wicket
Mahmudullah to Raina, 1 run, quicker on the stumps, worked to long-on
Mahmudullah to Raina, 2 runs, dropped short and all Raina does is pick it up over square leg. Could have taken more off that
Mahmudullah, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, good dive at backward point and Raina's open-batted glide, and that after making room, fetches just the single. India need 52 runs in 48 balls
Mustafizur to Raina, no run, short 133ks ball booming over his right shoulder, Raina just evades it. The last thing he wants to give away his wicket to
Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, gives this pull shot a real go. Had his weight in front, so the hands had to generate all the power
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, swivelled round the corner there

Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, he's jumped out of the crease to the wrong length. Shorter than he thought, just manages to chip it over Tamim running back from extra cover say. And the batsmen settle for a single, after nearly colliding into each other. Raina wasn't keen on the second
Mustafizur to Raina, 1 run, cleanly makes room, exposing the stumps entirely, and picks Mustafizur with an open-bat punch through covers
Mustafizur Rahman [2.0-0-15-1] is back into the attack
Uskaru says: Where is Nazmul Islam? -- On the field. Not bowling because of the two left-handers.

Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, no run, Bangladesh review: Dhawan charges down and nearly yorks himself, and Rahim looked convinced behind the stumps. Seems to be no bat on first replay. Clearly missing the inside edge. Ball tracking is in, and it's umpire's call on impact and wickets. Just tickling the leg-stump, so the onfield decision stays. And so does Bangladesh's review
We have a referral here ..
Vrushank says: Off late, Dhawan's love is not limited to just ICC tournaments. Hope we witness more darker shades in his purple patch.
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, no run, front leg out on the push but can't beat mid-off
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, no run, not the first time we've seen Dhawan miss that. The sweep, early into the shot and was hit on the forearm there
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, 1 run, makes room and has to open-battedly squeeze out a quicker delivery aimed for the stumps
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, slider, Raina prods out a forward defence
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, gets a big stride out and sweeps it round the corner

Soumya Sarkar to Raina, FOUR, that is Raina at his very best. Looks so composed when he plays that chipped loft over extra cover. Stays stable at the crease and opens up the off-side with exquisite timing

Soumya Sarkar to Raina, no run, looks to be cheeky, stands way outside leg and was made to reach out for a full and wide delivery, makes contact off the toe-end and trips over after losing balance. Looked comical realtime
Soumya Sarkar to Dhawan, 1 run, veering in full at the stumps, Dhawan creams the flick through mid-wicket
Devesh Sharma says: Missing the India vs SA Test series. After that nothing seems interesting enough.
Soumya Sarkar to Raina, 1 run, charges out of his crease and chips the cut behind point
Soumya Sarkar to Raina, wide, digs it short and gets too much height on that, called wide
Soumya Sarkar to Dhawan, 1 run, advances and adjusts smartly to splice the punch wide of mid-off
Soumya Sarkar to Dhawan, no run, 115ks, Dhawan had to generate pace on that, punch-drives as hard as he can, but can't get it past cover
Soumya Sarkar, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, stays legside, opens the bat face and taps the ball to cover
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, firmly punches to short cover and speeds off for a quick single
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, 1 run, nicely flicked away behind square

Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, another 94ks slider, Dhawan fails to lay bat on the defensive push and is hit pretty high on the pad. Appeal for leg before, but the angle might have taken it down leg. They don't conisder a review either
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, 1 run, tucked away through square leg, Mehidy Hasan is just firing it in
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, shuffles down the pitch and works this quicker delivery through mid-wicket
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, 1 run, fuller and wider, Dhawan inside edges his drive onto the pad and gathers a single as the ball escapes into the off-side
Taskin Ahmed to Raina, 1 run, digs it into the pitch, Raina hops and drops the ball into the vacant spaces at mid-wicket, easy single
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, 1 run, touch short, Dhawan's quick to rock back and pull to deep square
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, no run, better. Keeps it full on off-stump, Dhawan drives, but can't pierce the gap on the off-side
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, FOUR, another swivel and this one's shovelled to the deep backward square fence. Taskin needs to reconsider his lengths, can't keep bowling short to such a quality batsman

Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, SIX, when you bowl a short ball to Dhawan around leg stump, you better head back to your bowling crease, because there is only one way the ball's gonna go. Into the stands. 12 rows back. SD swivels and parcels it into the vacant stands over fine leg
Taskin Ahmed [1.0-0-9-0] is back into the attack
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, looped up around off, pushed back to the bowler
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, presses forward and drives a slider to the left of short extra cover, a diving stop from the fielder there
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, shortens his length and pushes it aroud middle, Dhawan clips to deep square
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, 1 run, eases a single down to long-off
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, SIX, Raina's go-to stroke against the spinners, the slogsweep. Goes down on one knee, picks the flight and lauches Mehidy Hasan over cow corner. Clean as a whistle
Mehidy Hasan to Raina, no run, quicker delivery, fires it in on the stumps, Raina tucks himself into a block
Rubel to Dhawan, no run, is happy to sit back and bunt this length ball into the off-side

Rubel to Raina, 1 run, dropped. Mehidy, the fielder. He was standing at leg gully position, had very less reaction time, straight in and straight out. All that after Raina flicked one off his pads, another day and it would have gone straight into the hands of the fielder
Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, lovely late cut now, saunters across for a single to square third man
Rubel to Dhawan, FOUR, short around off-stump, Dhawan had enough time to pick his spot, swivels and lays into the pull through mid-wicket

Rubel to Raina, 1 run, a direct hit at the bowler's end would have been curtains for Raina. He taps the ball in front of cover and calls for a quick single, had to put in a desperate headfirst dive and thankfully for him the throw misses the target
Suresh Raina, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Anthony says: Very bad move to send Rishabh Pant at No. 3. India you should trust in Raina and make him bat at one down on a more consistent basis.

Rubel to Pant, out Bowled!! Ah, this is getting contagious. Another chop on, Rishabh Pant the latest entrant. Must say, this was a poor shot selection from the Delhi lad, gets width alright but he is so reluctant to move his feet, just throws the kitchen sink in hope and drags it back onto his timbers. Pant b Rubel 7(8) [4s-1]
Rubel to Pant, THAT'S OUT!! Bowled!!
Rubel Hossain [1.0-0-9-0] is back into the attack
Mehidy Hasan to Pant, 1 run, dabs the ball to cover and nabs another quick single
Mehidy Hasan to Pant, no run, jumps down the pitch and quickly realizes he ain't gonna get to the pitch of the ball, nicely pads it away with an extended lunge forward
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run, slider, looks to tuck Dhawan for room, he nudges it into the leg-side and takes off
Mehidy Hasan to Dhawan, FOUR, risky, but effective. Reaches out for the flighted delivery outside off and controls the sweep behind square, no-one in the deep
Mehidy Hasan to Pant, 1 run, smart batting this from the youngster. Pushes the ball in front of cover and sneaks a quick single
Abinash das says: The amount of talent Rohit has is inversely proportional to his consistency
Mehidy Hasan to Pant, no run, floats it up around off-stump, Pant prods forward and defends solidly
Mehidy Hasan, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
Time for spin now. Mehedi with the ball, one slip in place
Mustafizur to Pant, 1 run, full and homing in towards middle and leg, Pant goes whack on the flick, drags it off the inside half to deep square
Mustafizur to Pant, FOUR, yorker? No problem says Rishabh Pant who unveils those mighty bottom hand power to whiplash it over mid-wicket. Gee, he hit that really hard
Mustafizur to Pant, no run, here is a chance for the outrageously talented Rishabh Pant. Gets a short ball first up and he mistimes the pull to short fine leg
Rishabh Pant, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Mustafizur to Rohit, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Another failure for Rohit Sharma. No room on offer on this cross seam delivery, Rohit decides to sit back and guide it down to third man with an open bat face, the ball darted back in a touch to catch the inside edge and shatter the stumps. He looked good in his brief stay and I'm sure he would be gutted having failed to convert this into a big one. Rohit b Mustafizur 17(13) [4s-3]
Mustafizur to Rohit, THAT'S OUT!! Bowled!!
Mustafizur to Rohit, no run, full outside off, driven gorgeously, but straight it goes to the man at cover
Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, gentle length delivery sprayed on the pads, Dhawan helps it through square leg for a single
Mustafizur Rahman [1.0-0-9-0] is back into the attack
Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, full and zooms in towards the pads, Dhawan drills it straight and a half-stop from Rubel enables the single
Arun Thomas says: Rishabh Pant should bat at number 3 today.
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, turns his bat face early on the flick and sends a leading edge behind point
Rubel to Rohit, wide, looks to slash a wide delivery, too far outside off stump, wided

Rubel to Rohit, no run, that's a corker, bowled at 140ks. Lands on back of a length and takes off.. Rohit searches for the ball with an air of uncertainty, nowhere near; the ball seamed away with a lot of oomph and the extra bounce made Rohit look like a school boy. Well past the edge
Rubel to Dhawan, 1 run, shapes it back into Dhawan, he gets a big inside edge onto pad that rolls into the square leg area
Rubel to Rohit, 1 run, wide of off-stump, Rohit steers a single down to third man
Rubel to Rohit, FOUR, edged and four! Straightens off the seam around off-stump, catches a thick outside edge as Rohit looks to push off the back foot and off she goes....very fine of third man
Rubel Hossain, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Taskin Ahmed to Dhawan, no run, 137ks, pitches outside leg and leaps sharply into Dhawan who fails to lay bat on the tuck, hit on the thigh pad and drops dead near his feet
Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, 1 run, angled in on middle, worked away into the leg-side for a single

Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, not too much width but Rohit has such good hand-eye co-ordination. Lazy elegance. Times the pants of this length ball as he crashes it square on the off-side, no-one moved
Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, no run, bowls it full and straight, Rohit's drive finds mid-on
Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, FOUR, nonchalant! Picks up the length early and nails the pull over mid-wicket. Fast hands, excellent timing and placement

Taskin Ahmed to Rohit, no run, and there comes the typical Rohit Sharma tentative push. Hangs his bat outside off sans any feet and gets beaten on the outside edge. Lovely away movement on offer there for Taskin
Taskin Ahmed, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Similar field for Taskin
Mustafizur to Dhawan, no run, 134ks short ball, climbs up over Dhawan's head as he watches it sail over to the keeper
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, slower ball on the stumps, Rohit waits on the back foot and tucks it round the corner
Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, fizzes off the pitch and rushes onto Dhawan, he deflects it off the inside half into the leg-side
Mustafizur to Dhawan, 2 runs, picks it up off his pads and chips the flick over mid-wicket, got a faint leading edge on that but he had placed it in the gap
Mustafizur to Dhawan, FOUR, width and bam! Dhawan sits back and flays that behind point. Can't bowl there to Dhawan, he is so dismissive
Mustafizur to Rohit, 1 run, bowls it on back of a length and slants it wide of off-stump, Rohit opens the bat face and guides a single down to third man
Rohit and Dhawan are at the crease. Rohit is on strike. Mustafizur will open the attack
Right then, India need 140. The fizz will begin proceedings for Bangladesh. Rohit to take strike. One slip in place. Off we go...

Lowest totals defended against India in T20Is:
126 NZ, Nagpur, 2016
130 SA, Trentbridge, 2009
145 Zim, Harae, 2015

Shankar: Yeah definitely. I have been enjoying this. Very important for me to adapt. I believe it is a difficult length (short of length) to get after. It (the surface) looks pretty similar. We took wickets with the new ball and in the middle overs. If we bat to our potential, we should get this score.

Joydeep Bardhan says: India is testing their reserve bench by giving their B and C teams a go. Nothing wrong in that since it is exposing the amount of improvements that need to be done to close the margin with the A team. But a question remains - is it worth losing the hard earned points and standards set by the senior team?

India would be mighty pleased with their bowling effort. It could have been better had all the chances been taken. Wickets at regular intervals kept pegging Bangladesh back. Only Liton Das and Sabbir Rahman got into the 30s, while the rest of the batsmen could not convert their starts. Shankar, Chahal and Sundar were tidy in the middle overs and the reason Bangladesh did not get momentum. India should fancy their chances with this target, especially with the top three. Back soon with the reply..

SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, 1 run, another single to finish the innings. Bangladesh finish with 139. Short delivery aimed right at the batsman, Taskin splices the pull towards mid-wicket and has to be content with a single

SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, wide, slower delivery slips out and sprays it outside off, Karthik had to move quickly to his left to glove that. It would have cost Thakur more had Karthik not moved across
SN Thakur to Mustafizur, 1 run, advances and takes it on the full, cue-ends the drive to sweeper cover
SN Thakur to Mustafizur, no run, bouncer just too good for Mustafizur, he stays leg-side and even steps out, but the ball sails over the attempted pull shot. Another dot from Thakur

Harsha Bhogle: I guess you judge a surface after both teams have batted on it but at this stage India's batsmen might want to thank the bowlers.
Tweet
Share
Reply
View All
SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, 1 run, cross-seam delivery and Taskin drags the heave off the inner half to deep mid-wicket
Mustafizur Rahman, left handed bat, comes to the crease

SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, out Rubel Run Out!! 1 run completed. Taskin wanted to keep strike and Rubel had to sacrifice. Thakur follows a backing away Taskin and pings the yorker, squeezed out to long-on and Rubel was pushed for the second by his partner. Raina got to the ball and sent a flat throw to Thakur, who fumbled but the ball deflected right onto the stumps. Rubel run out (Raina/SN Thakur) 0(1)
SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, THAT'S OUT!! Run Out!!
Run-out check sent upstairs. Rohit is not excited. He reckons Thakur dropped the ball before dislodging the bail. He did. But the ball drops on the stumps luckily for him. OUT!
SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, no run, round the wicket and starts with a heavy ball - short of length around off, Taskin is beaten for pace. The ball had already past him when he attempted the pull shot

Unadkat to Rubel, no run, big swing and a miss from Rubel. He went deep in the crease to the back of a length delivery and missed it altogether. Unadkat finishes with three albeit being expensive, 4-0-38-3
Rubel Hossain, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, out Caught by Karthik!! Rahman took his chance, but with so much technology, he was not getting away with it. Very full and outside off, almost close to the yorker length, Rahman hits his bat onto the ground while trying to squeeze it out, the ball takes the outside edge and Karthik does the rest. Rahman was hoping it would be a bump ball, which was not the case. Sabbir Rahman c Karthik b Unadkat 30(26) [4s-3 6s-1]
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!

Rahman has referred a caught behind decision. India started to celebrate even before the decision. It went in favour though. Rahman was quick to challenge it. Legal delivery. Looks like it has come off the outside edge. Not a bump all. UltraEdge only confirms the onfield call.
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, wide, this is a fair call. The wide yorker goes too far outside off
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, wide, that's a harsh call. The off-cutter decked off the surface, beating Rahman's pull shot. It was well inside the tramline and still been called
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, no run, much better. The wide yorker outside off, Rahman can't dig it out

Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, SIX, Unadkat is predictable with his length and pace, the off-cutter on back of a length, Rahman goes deep in the crease and waits for the delivery, then nails the pull over deep square leg. Just manages to clear the rope

Unadkat to Taskin Ahmed, leg byes, 1 run, back of a length and Taskin fails to meet with the flick, the ball drops on the surface after hitting the thigh pad and Rahman calls for a quick run, Unadkat has a shy at the bowler's end and misses
Unadkat to Taskin Ahmed, FOUR, starts the over well. Unadkat pitches it right in the arc, Taskin clears his front leg and heaves it to wide long-on, not off the meat but it was in the gap
SJ says: At the most crucial stage of the innings (back end), BD are imploding. Disappointed this won't be a competitive match.
SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, 1 run, another delivery dug into the surface, Taskin jumps across and helps it along the way to fine leg. Just the two off the over and more importantly Taskin keeps strike
SN Thakur to Taskin Ahmed, no run, slants the short of length delivery in, Taskin hops and tucks to mid-wicket
Round the wicket
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, finally makes connection. The normal speed short of length delivery, Rahman is rushed on the pull and mistimes it through mid-wicket, settles with a single
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, another play and miss. The knuckle ball on a shortish length, Rahman walks down and swings blindly across the line, nowhere close to the ball
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, off-pace delivery and Rahman is early into the steer to third man, no contact once again
Abdul Hafeez says: Time for Sabbir Rahman's crucial wicket
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run, back of a length around off, Rahman swings and misses. He went too hard and lost his shape
Shardul Thakur [2.0-0-18-1] is back into the attack
Unadkat to Taskin Ahmed, no run, pounded short and hits the bat hard, defended with an angled bat to backward point
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, short and around the hips, tucked square on the leg-side, for a single
Taskin Ahmed, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Unadkat to Mehidy Hasan, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Another one gone. Bangladesh need to play around Rahman. Hasan backs away and is followed by a back of a length delivery, not too much room to free his arms and hence the mistime on the heave, right off the splice and Pandey runs across from long-on to complete the formalities. Mehidy Hasan c Manish Pandey b Unadkat 3(4)
Unadkat to Mehidy Hasan, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!

Harsha Bhogle: Not exactly been gripping cricket so far. Bowlers wouldn't mind the fact that Bangladesh aren't challenging them enough.
Tweet
Share
Reply
View All
Unadkat to Mehidy Hasan, wide, bouncer is too high and is rightly called a wide. Hasan had no chance of connecting with that
Back over the wicket
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, back of a length on off, Rahman drops it near backward point and sets off
Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, much needed boundary for Bangladesh. Short and outside off, Rahman had the space to free his arms, he uncorks his wrists to cut it fiercely past point. Raced away!
Round the wicket

Simmon says: Although I haven't seen much of Vijay Shankar yet, I feel he has a better temperament than Hardik and his bowling is also multi-dimensional as compared to Pandya. But I think it is too early to make comparisons as we haven't seen much of his fielding and batting.
Unadkat to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, angled outside off and Hasan uses that to his advantage to run a single to third man
Jaydev Unadkat [2.0-0-18-1] is back into the attack
Chahal to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, slower and the shortish length allowed Hasan to work it to mid-wicket, Chahal mops up and he too finishes a tidy spell. Figures of 4-0-19-1
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, dragged back length and Rahman pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Mehidy Hasan, 1 run, shuffles across, got down on his knee and scooped it over Karthik, right over him
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, excellent work from Chahal. The googly is tucked to mid-wicket, no one there and Chahal ran quickly, covered good ground and released the ball. Kept it to a single
JAY says: Last 5 Overs. Even 60+ runs from here will take B'desh to around 160. That should be chaseable.
Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run, nice loopy delivery, Rahman plunges forward and defends
Mehidy Hasan, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Chahal to Liton Das, out Caught by Raina!! Das is waiting. The umpire checks for a no-ball. Fine. Back he goes. Shimmies down and gives himself some room which made him reach out for the flighted delivery, mistimes it towards long-off. It came right off the toe-end. Raina stations himself underneath and reverse cups it. Das was set and had to bat through. Liton Das c Raina b Chahal 34(30) [4s-3]
Chahal to Liton Das, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!
Yuzvendra Chahal [3.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, seven runs off the final delivery. Ruins the figures of Shankar somewhat. Low full toss outside off, Rahman bent his back knee and scooped it over short fine. The pace on the delivery did the rest
Free-hit on the way

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, no ball, he's struggling to complete his over. Two wides followed by an overstep. Speared in full and Rahman squeezes it out to extra cover, Das is sent back on the single
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, wide, loopy full delivery outside off, Rahman drives and misses. The umpire takes his own time to signal a wide, right call but took too much time
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, wide, bumper down leg and Rahman lets it pass, wide called. Will it make Shankar pay?

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 2 runs, dropped! But it was the toughest of the lot. The cross-seamer outside off, Rahman reaches out and skies it towards mid-wicket, Shankar runs all the way from his followthrough and gets both hands, but the momentum makes the ball pop out. He might have also overran a bit. Full marks for effort though
Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, the heavy ball from Shankar once more, pounded hard and close to off, Rahman is through the pull shot and the ball sails over the top-edge
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 1 run, low full toss and Das laps it towards long leg, this time Sundar cleaning up

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, premeditation from Das, walked across to play the scoop, but a clever Shankar pulled the length back, flies over the flashing blade of Das. Right on top of leg-stump

Vijay Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, short of length around off, Rahman helps it down to deep backward square with a pull. Chahal does well to keep it to a single, attacked the ball and released it quickly
Vijay Shankar [3.0-0-21-2] is back into the attack
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, flatter and outside off, dabbed to short third man. Sundar is done for the evening, another economical outing for him, 4-0-23-0
Murugesh says: Washington has bowled exceptionally well in the limited chances he has got so far. I think the selectors should give him a long rope to keep his aspirations high.
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 1 run, fired full and on the pads, nurdled round the corner
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, wide, pushed it too far outside off, Das can't reach for the cut, wide given
Round the wicket
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 2 runs, steps out and chips it inside out to sweeper cover, wide of Dhawan and the two was on
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, quicker and at the stumps, Rahman reverse sweeps square and near sweeper
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 1 run, low full toss and Das under edges the reverse sweep towards backward point. He would have been better of playing a conventional sweep to the bad delivery

Washington Sundar to Liton Das, FOUR, once more the batsman manages to split two fielders. Das dances down the wicket and lofts it with the turn over mid-wicket, Unadkat from long-on put in the dive but the ball still rolled over

SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR, the extra ball ruins the over for Thakur. Pitched up around off, Rahman almost checks his drive and chips it uppishly, but luckily for him it was right between cover and mid-off
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, wide, effort delivery from Thakur, the grunt was also heard, bouncer just outside off, Rahman lets it sail over him. The square leg umpire does not like the height on that
SN Thakur to Liton Das, 1 run, rolled his fingers across the ball and Das nudged it through unmanned mid-wicket. He wanted the second but Dhawan ensures that the duo stay put
SN Thakur to Liton Das, no run, yorker outside off, Das can't squeeze it out, right underneath his bat
SN Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, fuller delivery to which Rahman hangs back, the block rolls away past mid-wicket and to long-on
SN Thakur to Liton Das, 1 run, once more dug in and Das swivel pulls it to deep backward square, on the bounce to Dhawan
SN Thakur to Liton Das, 2 runs, banged in and cramped Das for room, he backed away and spliced the pull straight over Thakur, Pant from long-on runs across and tidies up, two added
Shardul Thakur [1.0-0-8-1] is back into the attack
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, fired into the blockhole and Rahman jams it to back to Sundar
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 1 run, tossed up and Das fetches the sweep from outside off, mistimed through mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, no run, flatter and around off, Das punches it meekly to cover
Gopal nath says: To improve catching maybe a vision and finger test should be included in the yo-yo test
Washington Sundar to Liton Das, wide, might have slipped out of his hand, full toss down leg and Das lets it pass
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run, shortens the length and Rahman tucks it square on the leg-side

Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, now tries a fancy reverse sweep, but Sundar had slowed it up - the ball arrived after the shot was played. Strikes Rahman on the thigh pad and drops near his feet
Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run, beaten. Sundar back and he beats the bat. The straight roller outside off, Rahman plays for the turn with a big lunge forward and is beaten
Washington Sundar [2.0-0-9-0] is back into the attack

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, almost had another. Das shuffles across to play the lap, the length does not aid him and he misses it by a long way. Shankar had dragged the length back smartly. Another eventful over from him
Sabbir Rahman, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Tame, tame dismissal. Shankar making up for those two drop catches in his first over, has two wickets in his kitty now. Nothing but a harmless back of a length outside off, Mahmudullah can't resist going after, punches it uppishly to sweeper cover. The intent was to take it over the point fielder, but he got it squarer than he would have liked. Mahmudullah c SN Thakur b Vijay Shankar 1(8)
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, no run, back of a length just outside off, Mahmudullah stays back and knocks it to the right of Shankar
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, no run, sharp bouncer that is also well-directed, right at the batsman, Mahmudullah watches it all along and sways away from the line of the delivery
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 1 run, fullish and outside off, Das once more looks to target the cow corner fence and drags it off the cue-end to long-on, just a single as Pant tidies up
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, wide, sees the batsman walk across his stumps and spears a low full toss down leg, wide called. The free-hit stays..
Free-hit coming up
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no ball, oversteps and fires it full outside off, jammed out towards cover. Shankar has been teasing the line for a while now and has finally been penalized
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, on a length and outside off, Das tries an ugly hack to the leg-side and misses

Russel Arnold on air clears the confusion surrounding Rahim's wicket. Umpire Lyndon Edward Hannibal is generally late in making his decision, so Karthik and Rohit went up before he raised the finger. But the onfield call was OUT and the only thing that they were checking for was a no-ball. Shankar was fine on that account and Rahim then started to make the walk.
Praveen Balaji says: @shashank pandey He is the captain of MI for years and lifts trophies for them.. I doubt your statement
Chahal to Mahmudullah, no run, darted outside off, Mahmudullah dabs it in front of point
Chahal to Liton Das, 1 run, tossed up delivery outside off, Das fetches it from way outside off and sweeps it over mid-wicket. A single taken
Chahal to Mahmudullah, 1 run, slow and low on the pads, Mahmudullah flicks that away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Mahmudullah, no run, flighted delivery around off, Mahmudullah pushes it in front of cover-point
Chahal to Mahmudullah, no run, quicker delivery on middle and leg, Mahmudullah goes for a wild heave and ends up getting an inside edge on his pad. Could have easily chopped that on
Chahal to Liton Das, 1 run, tossed up delivery on middle and leg, Das tucks that away to deep mid-wicket and takes a single
Vijay Shankar to Mahmudullah, no run, short of a length around off, Mahmudullah looks to punch that and gets an under edge
Mahmudullah, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Vijay Shankar to Rahim, out Caught by Karthik!! The keeper knew it was out and he asked for the review straightaway. He's bang on with his call. Length delivery outside off, Rahim comes down the track, throws his bat at and gets a feather to it. Though the onfield decision was not out, India called for the review and got it right. UltraEdge confirms the same and Rahim has to make the long walk back to the pavilion. Rahim c Karthik b Vijay Shankar 18(14) [4s-2 6s-1]
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!

India have taken a review against Rahim for a caught behind. The onfield decision was not out. What do the replays have in store for us? There's a definite edge. Waiting for UltraEdge... And there it is! OUT!
shashank pandey says: Poor fielding added with poor field placements. 2 catches dropped along with many landing safely. Rohit needs some advice currently

Vijay Shankar to Rahim, SIX, pulled away! Short delivery again with not much pace in it. Rahim has plenty of time to pick the length and pummel it over mid-wicket. Hits the scoreboard on the full and the umpire raises his arms
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 1 run, on a length and outside off, Liton steers it down to third man with an open face of his bat
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, banged short around middle and leg, Das is way down the track as he attempts a pull and misses

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, FOUR, short and punished. Short delivery well outside off, Das reaches out for it and slaps it through the gap at covers. No real pace in that delivery by Vijay Shankar and gets the treatment it deserved
suyog acharya says: it looks like Chahal is missing Dhoni behind the stumps!!

Harsha Bhogle: India has to accept there is an issue with catching.
Tweet
Share
Reply
View All
Chahal to Liton Das, 1 run, shortish on middle and leg, worked to backward square leg for a single

Chahal to Rahim, leg byes, 1 run, quicker one on the pads, Rahim gets struck on the pads as he fails to connect his flick. As the ball rolls to the left side of the pitch, Rahim calls for a run. Karthik sprints to collect the ball and goes for a direct hit at the striker's end, can't hit though. That was close. Might have been a run out
Chahal to Liton Das, 1 run, loopy delivery around off, Das puts on his dancing shoes and drives it uppishly through the gap at cover
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, dipping into the batsman and a bit fullish in length. Rahim moves away and angles that in front of gully. Clever bowling by the leggie on that occasion
Chahal to Rahim, no run, comes down the wicket and pushes the tossed up delivery back to the bowler
Chahal to Rahim, no run, loopy delivery on middle and leg, Rahim tries to flick that, ends up getting a leading edge. Almost chips it back to the bowler
"Raina, at the end of that over, patted Shankar to encourage him. Probably a word of apology as well," spots Shirshendu.
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, no run, back of a length around off, Liton Das knocks that back to the bowler

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 2 runs, that's the second dropped catch of the over. Butter fingers? Short of a length around middle, Das pulls this one towards fine leg where Sundar comes running in, gets his hands to it and spills it out. Raina earlier and Sundar now! India are struggling in the field today. Quite unlike them
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, back of a length around off, Rahim has whipped that to mid-wicket for a single

Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 1 run, how can you drop that, says the commentator on air. And when a fielder like Suresh Raina does that, can't get any worse. Short of a length delivery around off, Das goes for a pull and mistimes it towards mid-off where Raina puts down a sitter.
Vijay Shankar to Liton Das, 2 runs, good length delivery that sticks in the surface. Das tries to work that away to the on-side, ends up getting a leading edge over mid-wicket
Vijay Shankar to Rahim, 1 run, on a length around off, Rahim pokes his bat at it and gets an inside edge. Just past the stump and to the left side of the keeper
Vijay Shankar, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Chahal to Rahim, 1 run, aimed on middle and leg, Rahim nudges it in front of mid-wicket and takes a single to retain strike

Chahal to Rahim, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries. Flighted delivery on leg, Rahim goes down on his knee, gets in position early and sweeps that away through mid-wicket. That was hit with a lot of authority by the veteran
Chahal to Rahim, FOUR, that's t20 cricket. Changes grips and reverse sweeps the flighted delivery nonchalantly over point to get off the mark in style
dewansh says: A good encouraging decision from Indian team management to not replace the players who didn't perform in last match such as Rishab and Shardul. It will boost their confidence.
Chahal to Rahim, no run, another floater delivery on off, Rahim looks to attack the delivery with a heave, doesn't middle it though
Chahal to Rahim, no run, full and straight on middle and leg, Rahim is on his front foot as he blocks it off his front foot
Chahal to Rahim, no run, flighted delivery coming into the batsman after pitching outside leg, Rahim defends it off his back foot
Yuzvendra Chahal, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
Mushfiqur Rahim, right handed bat, comes to the crease

SN Thakur to Tamim, out Caught by Unadkat!! Thakur gets his man. Couldn't get the lbw in his favour but does him with a short delivery. Bangs it short on middle and Tamim is in no position as he attempts the pull shot. The top edge flies to short fine leg where Unadkat makes no mistake and takes a reverse cup. Thakur was probably destined to get the opener's wicket. Tamim c Unadkat b SN Thakur 15(16) [4s-2]
SN Thakur to Tamim, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!

SN Thakur to Tamim, FOUR, not timed but enough on it to race away. Short of a length around off, Tamim walks down the wicket and flat bats it. Doesn't middle that but gets it over the fielder at mid-off and finds the boundary
SN Thakur to Tamim, FOUR, insult to injury. Full in length outside off, Tamim charges down the wicket and slams it through the gap at covers. Good looking shot by the southpaw.

SN Thakur to Tamim, no run, decision overturned! That was a really good DRS by Tamim Iqbal. Tamim tried to flick that away before he got rapped on the pads. As it was pitching outside leg, the onfield decision has to be reversed. Good call by the batsman there
Tamim has been adjudged lbw and he has decided to challenge the onfield call. Looked out to the naked eye. Isn't!

SN Thakur to Tamim, no run, full and wide outside off, Tamim dances down the track and tries to reach for it, can't connect his shot though. Saw the batsman walk down the track and fired it outside off. Clever
SN Thakur to Tamim, no run, back of a length outside off, Tamim cuts it hard but can't find the gap. Straight to the man at point
Shardul Thakur, right-arm medium, comes into the attack

"Liton Das's promotion to No.3 was hinted at by Mahmudullah at the PC yesterday. He'd a word of praise for Liton, who did well in the practice game against SL BP XI. He scored an 18-ball 40-odd. So Rahim slips down to No.4, he batted at 3 against Sri Lanka at home. Guess, the musical chairs will continue until Shakib returns," pings Shirshendu.

Washington Sundar to Liton Das, FOUR, nicely done. Grounds his knee and sweeps the flighted delivery over square leg. On a bounce and into the fence. Good thinking by the batsman there, he knew there was no fielder in the deep and he picked the right shot and the right spot
Washington Sundar to Tamim, 1 run, flatter on middle and leg, worked away to deep mid-wicket by Tamim for a single

Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, in the air... but safe. That's been dropped, in fact. Tossed up delivery on off, Tamim dances down the wicket and drives it uppishly to cover. Rohit puts in a dive forward, gets his hands to it but spills it out. Was difficult, but should have been taken
Shamm says: Let's see how SN Thakur bowls today
Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, shortish delivery at 83 kph outside off, Tamim reaches for it and punches it to Chahal at cover-point
Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, fired on the pads, Tamim goes deep in his crease and tickles it to square leg. That was bowled really quick
Washington Sundar to Tamim, no run, floated around off, Tamim pushes it back to the bowler off his front foot

Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, grunts out loudly after bowling that full length delivery. On middle and leg, Tamim nudges it in front of deep square leg and takes a single. Wanted the second too, but Das sends him back. Quite an eventful over, that
Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run, shortish delivery shaping into the batsman, Das tucks it off his hips in order to get off the mark
Liton Das, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, out Caught by Chahal!! Unadkat draws first blood. Should have got his wicket in the first over itself, gets it a over later nevertheless. Pitches it up on middle and leg, Sarkar flicks it again but this time straight to the fielder at short fine leg. Chahal is the man who takes a sharp low catch and ends Sarkar's stay at the crease. Had struck a six earlier in the over, should have been more patient. Soumya Sarkar c Chahal b Unadkat 14(12) [4s-1 6s-1]
Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!
Nithish says: Bangladesh is a strong team. With the exposure they get in BPL, they have match winners in their team. T20 is unpredictable.
Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, wide, short and wide, in fact way outside off. Easy call for the umpire and Unadkat isn't pleased with himself
Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs, good length delivery on off, Sarkar shimmies down the wicket and chips it over mid-off. Doesn't get the proper timing, could have cleared the fence or else

Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, SIX, nonchalant hit. Full length delivery on middle and leg, Sarkar picks up the length early and with utter ease flicks it over the square leg fence. Half a dozen in his account and Unadkat has been put under pressure
Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, shortish delivery aimed at the hips, Tamim is on his toe as he flicks it over square leg. On a bounce to the fielder in the deep

Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, another delivery fired into the batsman. On middle and leg, Sarkar flicks that away to short square leg. Lucky there. Might have easily gone through his defence, if he was a tad late in getting his bat down
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, short and quick outside off, cuts it hard but finds the fielder at point
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, floated on off, Sarkar drives it back to the bowler off his front foot
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, sharp turn on that. Pitches outside off and spins away sharply to beat Sarkar's tentative push
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, fired in outside off, Sarkar brings his bat down and chops it to backward point
Washington Sundar to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR, smashed away! Short and wide outside off, Soumya Sarkar reaches for it and slaps it through the covers. First boundary of the innings and the match...
Washington Sundar, right-arm off break, comes into the attack

Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, three fielders converging on that and it falls in no man's land. Nobody called there, should have been taken. Lack of communication, the culprit there. On a length around off, Sarkar heaved it and got a top edge towards third man where there were three fielders (third man, backward point and cover-point) and no body went for it
Unadkat to Tamim, 3 runs, strays in line again. Length delivery on the pads, Tamim flicks it through square leg and takes three as the ball crawls away to the deep
HUZAIFA G says: India always favourite while chasing. they will have their tails up.
Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, good length delivery around the off-stump channel, Sarkar angles it past backward point and gets to the other end. A fumble from Pandey allowed that single
Unadkat to Soumya Sarkar, no run, that's a jaffa. In that corridor of uncertainty around the off stump channel. Sarkar tries to fend, gets beaten due to the undeviated delivery
Unadkat to Tamim, 1 run, first runs on the board. On a length and bowled on the pads, Tamim gets off the mark with an easy flick to fine leg
Unadkat to Tamim, no run, starts off with a shortish delivery outside off, Tamim lifts his bat and let's it through to the keeper
Tamim and Soumya Sarkar are at the crease. Tamim is on strike. Unadkat will open the attack
Bangladesh openers, Soumya Sarkar and Tamim Iqbal stride out in the middle. For India, Jaydev Unadkat will bowl the first over. "Let's play", says the umpire. Here we go!
Bangladesh have won only one out of their last 13 T20Is. That win came at this very venue against the hosts.

So the players are out in the middle. Both teams are lined up for their respective National Anthems. First up, it's team India, then Bangladesh... Can see an Indian fan waving the Indian flag in a rather empty stadium.
With Hardik Pandya, India's balance looks good but just about sustains itself; without him though, it goes awry, writes Harsha Bhogle on India's elusive balance

India vs Bangladesh T20Is:
Nottingham, 2009: Ind won by 25 runs
Mirpur, 2014: Ind won by 8 wkts
Mirpur, 2016: Ind won by 45 runs
Mirpur, 2016: Ind won by 8 wkts
Bengaluru, 2016: Ind won by one run
Teams:
Bangladesh (Playing XI): Tamim Iqbal, Soumya Sarkar, Mahmudullah(c), Mushfiqur Rahim(w), Liton Das, Sabbir Rahman, Mehidy Hasan, Nazmul Islam, Rubel Hossain, Taskin Ahmed, Mustafizur Rahman
India (Playing XI): Rohit Sharma(c), Shikhar Dhawan, Suresh Raina, Manish Pandey, Rishabh Pant, Dinesh Karthik(w), Washington Sundar, Vijay Shankar, Jaydev Unadkat, Yuzvendra Chahal, Shardul Thakur

Mahmudullah: "I would have bowled first. Anyway, we have to bat first, put up a good show and put up a good score on the board. We played a practice game and batters got some runs and bowlers had a good time too. We need to executive skills and try to be calm. We are going with five bowlers and six batters."

Rohit Sharma: "We are going to field first. Nothing in particular (on chasing). The wicket got better and better the other day. So why not use it to our advantage. Because we are playing on a different track, just want to make use of that. I believe in backing the players in the first place. There will be times like these, that teach us as a group. So, it's important to back the players and give them other opportunities. Hopefully they'll come out good."
India have won the toss and have opted to field
"Captains have walked out for the toss. Don't think there are even 500 people in attendance today. Can be a little exaggeration but just too little in the stands this evening."

"It's a different surface to be played on. It's around the 3-meter mark and 5-meter mark (the area to look out for). For the bowlers taking pace off the ball would be the key. It looks like a nice wicket again and 160-165 looks a par score. Certainly you got to strike first up, especially in the first 6 overs," reckons Brett Lee in the pitch report.
"Shardul and Unadkat marking their run-ups now while an enthusiastic Pant almost knocked Raina down trying to practice slip catching."

"Rishabh Pant and Suresh Raina having an extended run practicing the pull shot. Well.. KL and Hooda are back just before the team meeting, now if they wanted to have a hit before the game... B'desh players too far for my myopic eyesight."

"Fizz and Taskin just finished a long spell of bowling on the side wicket. Unadkat, Washington Sundar and Shardul are bowling on the other side. Rest of the Indian team are pretty much in 'Let's football' mood. Saw both KL Rahul and Deepak Hooda walk through the passage that leads to the outdoor nets facility, could be a sign that they aren't going to feature today as well. Unless they decide to embarrass me," adds Shirshendu.

"Ayubowan from the R. Premadasa. Today is perhaps the most pleasant Colombo weather has been since I have arrived. There was a forecast for thundershowers this afternoon, however it hasn't arrived. Skies look serene at the moment but you know how things can change in Sri Lanka," pings Shirshendu Roy from Colombo.

Though India is not playing to its full strength, they clearly have the upper hand over Bangladesh. Can the Bangla Tigers overhaul a wounded team India today? We shall find that out soon. Toss and teams in a bit. Stay tuned in for all the updates.

You could sense the lack of experience in India's bowling attack the other day as Kusal Perera thrashed Shardul Thakur all over the park in that Powerplay over. Yes, that single over could possibly turn out to be the highlight of the series. Also, the absence of Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni, Hardik Pandya, Jasprit Bumrah and Bhuvneshwar Kumar wouldn't make as much as a difference to India as much as Shakib Al Hasan's absence in that Bangladesh's playing XI. He's one player who can make all the difference, let's be honest.

18:10 IST: After facing defeat against Lankan Lions in the series opener, the Men in Blue will face-off Bangla Tigers in the second encounter of the Tri-Nation series today. Complacency, overconfidence, celebrations way before sealing the fate of the match - these words flash in our minds if we are to recollect the previous T20 encounter between India and Bangladesh - the one during World T20, 2016. Remember? Mahmudullah's rash shot in search of glory and Mushfiqur Rahim's fist pump even before the outcome of the game. How can one ever forget those moments?

Preview by Shirshendu Roy:

Bangladesh's confidence is at an all-time low with just one win from their last 10 T20Is. However, India's defeat at the hands of hosts Sri Lanka in the curtain raiser would have provided them some solace, and the prospect of facing off against a second-string Indian outfit will only give them hope. However, that doesn't guarantee them a win at the outset and skipper Mahmudullah and his boys will do well to remind themselves of that.

The last time these two teams met it was probably overconfidence that got the better of Bangladesh after they had swiped off 9 off the 11 required, off the first three balls of the final over of the 2016 World T20. Mahmudullah, who was one of the crucial wickets to fall in that fateful over, knows how even a little bit of complacency could come back to haunt them. They are without Shakib Al Hasan for starters, which robs Bangladesh off four miserly overs. His batting at a time when Bangladesh are struggling to sustain momentum through the middle order will be missed. However, opener Tamim Iqbal, before hopping onto the flight to Colombo, urged his teammates to not panic.

In the last 12 months, Bangladesh have played six T20Is and only three batsmen have scored over 100 runs - Soumya Sarkar (205), Mahmudullah (146) and Mushfiqur Rahim (110). The glaring exception in this list is Tamim, who has played only two of these six games. However, the team will turn to him in these desperate times to provide them with a ballistic start at the top. The bowling too seems to be short on ideas with Mustafizur Rahman, Taskin Ahmed and Rubel Hossain having been dealt harshly by the batsmen in recent times.

The challenges for the young Indian unit are different. To be without six of its starting players including skipper Virat Kohli is a setback in itself but it depends grossly on how the youngsters stepping in perceive the situation. While India will continue to make the best of these resources and win matches, they will also be tempted to present every youngster an opportunity to showcase their skills. Vijay Shankar's induction would have made the management happy while Shardul Thakur showed great heart to come back from a ravaging 27-run opening over. Washington Sundar was his usual self bowling with the new ball. Although the sample size of one loss is too little for India to seriously read into, they seem clearly confused with the balance of their side. Shankar and Suresh Raina will be expected to pitch in with four overs, whereas someone like a Sundar will have to double up his show with the bat whenever the need be.

As the series progresses, India will offer chances to Axar Patel and KL Rahul too - both having travelled with the team for some time now. Even Mohammed Siraj will have his chance at redeeming himself, so will Deepak Hooda who will look to showcase his prowess with the bat. All experiments without costing India a win.

When: Thursday (March 8), 7 PM Local, 1900 IST

Where: R. Premadasa Stadium, Colombo

What to expect: Another humid day is expected in the capital city, but this time with a remote possibility of thundershowers in the afternoon. Shikhar Dhawan spoke about the presence of dew in the opening game and that could show up again on Thursday.

Team News:

India

India find themselves in a tricky situation, one where they will be divided between handing the other guys on the bench a chance but give the ones who played in the first game a little longer run. Mohammed Siraj could be drafted in to replace Shardul but the latter recovered well from the early jolt.

Bangladesh

The No.3 conundrum continues to haunt Bangladesh in the absence of Shakib Al Hasan. They will, however, want Rahim to take up that spot. With the team in the middle of a prolonged losing streak, there's a lot of repair that needs to be done, and the best tonic in such times would be a win. But who stands up for them on the evening, only time will tell.

What they said:

The No.3 batting position has been playing on our minds for some time now. Sabbir Rahman had been doing well at that position, however in the past few games, the runs haven't really come but that is understandable, there'd be such phases for everyone - Mahmudullah, Bangladesh captain.

We are quite confident and we are going to go into the game with a positive mindset. We have just lost one game. It is not a big deal. Of course, we will learn from our mistakes. It is just a part and parcel of our work - Shikhar Dhawan, India's vice-captain.
Teams:

India (From): Rohit Sharma(c), Shikhar Dhawan, Suresh Raina, Manish Pandey, Rishabh Pant, Dinesh Karthik(w), Washington Sundar, Vijay Shankar, Jaydev Unadkat, Yuzvendra Chahal, Shardul Thakur, Lokesh Rahul, Deepak Hooda, Axar Patel, Mohammed Siraj

Bangladesh (From): Tamim Iqbal, Soumya Sarkar, Imrul Kayes, Mushfiqur Rahim(w), Mahmudullah(c), Sabbir Rahman, Mehidy Hasan, Taskin Ahmed, Rubel Hossain, Mustafizur Rahman, Nazmul Islam, Liton Das, Abu Jayed, Nurul Hasan, Ariful Haque, Abu Hider Rony
